definition[0]: a list of all the things in a place
example[0]: We made an inventory of everything in the apartment.
definition[1]: all the goods in a shop
definition[2]: the amount of stock, including RAW MATERIALs, supplies and finished goods, that a company has at a particular time
example[1]: Companies have cut inventories sharply since the downturn began.
example[2]: Cash-and-carry outlets rely on a rapid turnover of stock to keep down inventory levels.
definition[3]: a list of the goods and property owned by a particular person, organization, or country
example[3]: A full inventory of equipment will be maintained.
definition[4]: to make a list of goods that a company or a person has at a particular time
example[4]: Newmark & Lewis were closed Sunday to take inventory.
